verses.verse: Then answered<WH6030> Bildad<WH1085> the Shuhite<WH7747>, and said<WH559>,
How<WH575> long<WH5704> wilt thou speak<WH4448> these things? and how long shall the words<WH561> of thy mouth<WH6310> be like a strong<WH3524> wind<WH7307>?
Doth God<WH410> pervert<WH5791> judgment<WH4941>? or doth the Almighty<WH7706> pervert<WH5791> justice<WH6664>?
If thy children<WH1121> have sinned<WH2398> against him, and he have cast them away<WH7971> for<WH3027> their transgression<WH6588>; for: Heb. in the hand of their transgression
If thou wouldest seek<WH7836> unto God<WH410> betimes<WH7836>, and make thy supplication<WH2603> to the Almighty<WH7706>;
If thou wert pure<WH2134> and upright<WH3477>; surely now he would awake<WH5782> for thee, and make the habitation<WH5116> of thy righteousness<WH6664> prosperous<WH7999>.
Though thy beginning<WH7225> was small<WH4705>, yet thy latter end<WH319> should greatly<WH3966> increase<WH7685>.
For enquire<WH7592>, I pray thee, of the former<WH7223> <WH7223> age<WH1755>, and prepare<WH3559> thyself to the search<WH2714> of their fathers<WH1>:
(For we are but of yesterday<WH8543>, and know<WH3045> nothing, because our days<WH3117> upon earth<WH776> are a shadow<WH6738>:) nothing: Heb. not
Shall not they teach<WH3384> thee, and tell<WH559> thee, and utter<WH3318> words<WH4405> out of their heart<WH3820>?
Can the rush<WH1573> grow up<WH1342> without mire<WH1207>? can<WH7685> the flag<WH260> grow<WH7685> without<WH1097> water<WH4325>?
Whilst it is yet in his greenness<WH3>, and not cut down<WH6998>, it withereth<WH3001> before<WH6440> any other herb<WH2682>.
So are the paths<WH734> of all that forget<WH7911> God<WH410>; and the hypocrite's<WH2611> hope<WH8615> shall perish<WH6>:
Whose hope<WH3689> shall be cut off<WH6990>, and whose trust<WH4009> shall be a spider's<WH5908> web<WH1004>. web: Heb. house
He shall lean<WH8172> upon his house<WH1004>, but it shall not stand<WH5975>: he shall hold<WH2388> it fast, but it shall not endure<WH6965>.
He is green<WH7373> before<WH6440> the sun<WH8121>, and his branch<WH3127> shooteth forth<WH3318> in his garden<WH1593>.
His roots<WH8328> are wrapped about<WH5440> the heap<WH1530>, and seeth<WH2372> the place<WH1004> of stones<WH68>.
If he destroy<WH1104> him from his place<WH4725>, then it shall deny<WH3584> him, saying, I have not seen<WH7200> thee.
Behold, this is the joy<WH4885> of his way<WH1870>, and out of the earth<WH6083> shall others<WH312> grow<WH6779>.
Behold, God<WH410> will not cast away<WH3988> a perfect<WH8535> man, neither will he help<WH2388> <WH3027> the evil doers<WH7489>: help: Heb. take the ungodly by the hand
Till he fill<WH4390> thy mouth<WH6310> with laughing<WH7814>, and thy lips<WH8193> with rejoicing<WH8643>. rejoicing: Heb. shouting for joy
They that hate<WH8130> thee shall be clothed<WH3847> with shame<WH1322>; and the dwelling<WH168> place of the wicked<WH7563> shall come to nought<WH369>. shall come: Heb. shall not be
